description: RETENTION OF TWO STOREY SIDE EXTENSION AND EXTERNAL ALTERATIONS
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Notwithstanding the side extension has been erected, further works are proposed including alterations to the front elevation. The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.
Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: Site location plan and drawings Sheet 01 Rev 01, Sheet 02 Rev 01 & Sheet 03

Condition : 3 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development)(England) Order 2015 (or any order revoking and re-enacting that Order with or without modification), no window, door or other opening other than those expressly authorised by this permission shall be constructed in the flank elevation without planning permission first being obtained from the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - INFORMATIVE. The applicant is advised that this consent relates solely to the two storey side extension and assocaited alterations to elevations the subject of the application and does not grant or infer to grant permission for the front porch which has been built without the benefit of planning permission.
Condition : 5 - INFORMATIVE. The applicant is advised that the porch may be the subject of enforcement action under the Planning Acts to secure its removal.

Condition : 6 - INFORMATIVE: The applicant is requested to remove the porch forthwith which is considered to be overly bulky, unduly dominant and detracts from the appearance of the host dwelling and terrace and is contrary to policy DM.D3 of the Merton Sites and Policies Plan 2014.

Condition : 7 - In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) The applicant was offered the opportunity to submit amended plans in order to make the proposal acceptable in planning terms.
  ii) The application was approved without delay.
